You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Upgrade the B2B Commerce for Visualforce Managed Package

Install the release or patch build of the B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package that you're upgrading to.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To install a package:	Download AppExchange Packages
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
NOTE Before you install a new version of the managed package, prepare the existing data in your B2B Commerce for Visualforce environment.
Find and copy the installation URL for your org type and the build number that you want to install.
WARNING
Ensure that you install the same build for each of your orgs. If you install a specific build in a sandbox and test and validate against that version, ensure that you install the same build in production. For example, if you install build 3.136.1 in a sandbox org, also install build 3.136.1 in your production org.
If you're installing a patch, select the most recently available patch for that major release. Each new patch is cumulative, and contains all the fixes from the previous patches. There's no need to install each iterative patch since the version that you're currently using.
Upgrading from B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.29 or 3.136.28 to any build of B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ‘19 (version 4.10)? First, install Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.30, and then upgrade to Spring ‘19 (version 4.10).
Go to the URL you copied.
On the Package Installation Details screen, click Install for Specific Profiles (1), but don’t proceed to install until you complete the next step.
Scroll to your custom storefront user profile (2), and select B2B Commerce Community User (3) from the picklist.
Click Upgrade (4).
After installation completes, upgrade to the latest global configuration and custom settings data.
From the App Launcher, find and open B2B Commerce.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Global Settings.
TIP If you're upgrading from a version older than B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9), grant admins permission to access the CC Admin tab. Complete the steps in Assign Permissions for Storefront Admins.
In the Global Settings menu, select Data Loader.
In the Upgrade B2B Commerce Settings section, click Upgrade.
NOTE If you previously deleted any global custom settings records and the version you’re installing adds new records, clicking Upgrade reinserts the missing records.
Complete the appropriate upgrade steps for each version along your upgrade path.
NOTE For example, maybe you're upgrading from B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13). Complete all steps in each of the following topics.
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (Version 4.9)
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ‘19 (Version 4.10)
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11)
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12)
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (Version 4.13)
For the version of the managed package that you've installed, review the patch notes and complete any required upgrade steps.
Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (Version 4.9)
Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (Version 4.10)
Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11)
Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12)
Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (Version 4.13)
